sect1.title: What's New For Users
sect1.para: The GNOME Project's focus on users and usability continues in GNOME &gnomeversion; with its hundreds of bug fixes and user-requested improvements. The sheer number of enhancements make it impossible to list every change and improvement made but we hope to highlight some of the more exciting user-oriented features in this release of GNOME.

sect2.title: Say Cheese
sect2.para: GNOME 2.22 introduces a new application, Cheese. Cheese lets you take photos and make videos using your computer's webcam apply a range of different effects (like XXX and XXX) that you can share with your friends, load into F-Spot or set as your account photo.

sect2.title: Window Compositing
sect2.para: GNOME 2.22 introduces window compositing on capable platforms. Fitting with GNOME's "keeping it simple" policy, the features are very low key. The most noticable changes are drop shadows on windows, live previews when switching windows with Alt-Tab and transparency effects.
Not all graphics hardware reliably supports compositing, so this feature is currently turned off by default. To enable it... XXX XXX.

sect2.title: DVD, Digital TV and more
sect2.para: GNOME's Movie Player now offers improved support for DVD playback. Also new in GNOME 2.22 is support for digital television (DVB).
Also appearing in 2.22 are a selection of new plugins, including support for MythTV, Youtube and Tracker-based searching. Also new is playlist sharing and the ability to select subtitles for files.

sect2.title: International Clock
sect2.para: No need to do any more mental arithmatic to work out what time your teleconference starts in Sydney, GNOME 2.22 now has internationalisation built into its clock. Add locations from around the world to see the local time and weather.

sect2.title: Continual Evolution
sect2.para: Evolution continues to be improved with new support for Google Calendars and custom message labels (tagging) for your email.
Work has also gone into improving the speed of spam filtering and making error dialogs less intrusive on your desktop session by using the status bar rather than popups.

sect2.title: VNC Client
sect2.para: New in GNOME 2.22 is the Remote Desktop Viewer. This application complements the existing remote desktop server support in GNOME, it features the ability to discover machines on the local network and bookmark your favourites.
Users desiring more control over the remove desktop server will also appreciate the addition of an Advanced tab in the properties dialog.

sect2.title: But that's not all...
sect2.para: GNOME 2.22 also features many bug fixes and user-required enhancements from the last 6 months of development including:
